title: Gold Coast mother recalls the unthinkable moment she found her teenage son dead
text:
A heartbroken mother has relived the moment she found her son's body after he took his own life.

Aspiring DJ Jaidyn Bohl, 19, hanged himself in his Gold Coast home last October after struggling with anxiety and depression.

One year on, his grieving mother Sue Lamb has spoken out about her devastating loss in the hope other parents don't go through the pain of losing a child to suicide.

She recalled how her 'quiet but funny' son had been upset after breaking up with his girlfriend and found it hard to find a job.

It's been a year since Sue Lamb (right) lost her only child Jaidyn Bohl (left) to suicide

He was on a eight-week waiting list to see a psychologist and finally got an appointment on October 19.

Jaidyn told his mum afterwards it was a good session before heading to work at a steakhouse, where his manager later told Ms Lamb her son worked his 'best ever shift' and had been in high spirits.

When Jaidyn returned home from work, he spent his final hours playing music and cards with his best friend before walking him home - promising to meet him at the beach later that day.

Jaidyn worked his ''best ever shift' and was in high shifts just hours before died, aged 19

Sue Lamb (left) shared her story in the hope no other parents loses a child to suicide

His mother found her son's body outside their home later that morning.

'He looked so peaceful. He wasn't in any pain when he died. I started screaming, ''Help me, someone help me''. I just couldn't believe it,' Ms Lamb told The Gold Coast Bulletin.

She believes Jaidyn took his own life after losing hope, unable to get help he needed in a mental health system Ms Lamb described as 'broken'.

'By the time he realised he had a real problem with anxiety and depression, he had got himself into a real hole. I found out after his death that during that week, he had taken himself to a GP to talk to him about how much longer it would take for the medication to work,'she told the publication.

The aspiring Gold Coast DJ hung himself after a deep struggle with anxiety and depression

Ms Lamb said her 'unshakeable' faith in God had helped her get through the last 12 months, who has given her peace and believes Jaidyn is with him.

Ms Lamb has spoken out in the hope of addressing the growing epidemic of young people killing themselves.

'Suicide is everywhere. Our kids are exposed to sites that show them how to (kill) themselves. It shows you step 1, 2 and dead bodies. It's so wrong,' she said.
